subject: Re: [junit] Failing test exception
msgSnippet: I just tested with JUnit 3.4, and it works fine (i.e. no exception, and the test fails as expected.) I (finally) updated to ant 1.3, and the same problem
messageBody:
I just tested with JUnit 3.4, and it works fine (i.e. no exception, and the
test fails as expected.)

I (finally) updated to ant 1.3, and the same problem occurs - works fine
with 3.4, fails with 3.5.


Jim


At 11:05 AM 3/16/2001, you wrote:
>I'm getting a weird (to me, at any rate) exception with the one of my tests.
>
>
>This test passes, and causes no problems:
>public void testPidCountExpire()
>{
> String pid1 = "pgcode=075&lang=ENG&sport=BV&sex=W";
> String pid2 = "pgcode=075&lang=ENG&sport=BV&sex=M";
> String pid3 = "pgcode=073&lang=ENG&sport=BV&sex=M";
> transaction.addPid(pid1, "E");
> transaction.addPid(pid2, "E");
> transaction.addPid(pid3, "E");
> assertEquals("Pid count correct", 3, transaction.getPidCount());
>}
>
>
>
>When I changed the test to make sure it was failing correctly:
>public void testPidCountExpire()
>{
> String pid1 = "pgcode=075&lang=ENG&sport=BV&sex=W";
> String pid2 = "pgcode=075&lang=ENG&sport=BV&sex=M";
> String pid3 = "pgcode=073&lang=ENG&sport=BV&sex=M";
> transaction.addPid(pid1, "E");
> transaction.addPid(pid2, "E");
> transaction.addPid(pid3, "E");
> assertEquals("Pid count correct", 4, transaction.getPidCount());
>}
>
>I get the following exception:
>java.lang.AbstractMethodError
> at junit.framework.TestResult.addFailure(TestResult.java:46)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:127)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:121)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:157)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:152)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:157)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:152)
> at
>org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.run(JUni
>tTestRunner.java:202)
> at
>org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTask.execute(JUnitT
>ask.java:268)
> at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.execute(Target.java:153)
> at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.runTarget(Project.java:819)
> at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTarget(Project.java:533)
> at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTargets(Project.java:507)
> at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.runBuild(Main.java:421)
> at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.main(Main.java:149)
>
>
>I'm running the test under Ant 1.2 and JUnit 3.5 on Windows 2000. The
>compiler is Jikes.
>
>
>The classes compile correctly:
>compile:
> [echo] Compiling utils
> [javac] Compiling 20 source files to D:\classes
> [echo] Compiling tm
> [javac] Compiling 12 source files to D:\classes
> [echo] Compiling test source
> [javac] Compiling 3 source files to D:\classes
> [junit] Running sinfo.test.TMTestSuite
>
>
>Any ideas why?
>
>
>Jim
>
>
>
